name: Ziprasidone

dosing.adult_acute: 20 mg BID with food; IM: 10-20 mg every 2-4 hours (max 40 mg/day)
dosing.adult_maintenance: 40-80 mg BID with food (typical); max 160 mg/day
dosing.notes: MUST take with food (500 calories) for absorption; BID dosing required; weight neutral; IM available for acute agitation

canadian_clinical.titration_schedule: Increase to 40 mg BID on day 2-3; then increase by 20 mg BID every 2-3 days
canadian_clinical.max_dose_practice: 160 mg/day (80 mg BID); rarely go to max due to QTc concerns
canadian_clinical.inpatient_strategy: Start 40 mg BID with food; IM 10-20 mg for agitation (switch to oral within 3 days)
canadian_clinical.outpatient_strategy: Start 20 mg BID with meals; titrate to 40-80 mg BID based on response

warnings: Black box warning: Increased mortality in elderly with dementia-related psychosis
QTc prolongation - obtain baseline ECG and monitor; avoid if QTc >500 ms or with other QTc-prolonging drugs
MUST take with food (â‰¥500 calories) - bioavailability reduced by 50% on empty stomach
Weight neutral - excellent for metabolic concerns
Sedation and orthostatic hypotension (especially during titration)

cautions.renal: No adjustment needed; use caution in severe impairment
